result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
With Huber if revoked.
Consecutive to: 15CM01853

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with Kohl's Department stores. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
 ** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for compliance with Day Report Center for 60 Days. If defendant successfully completes DRC, the 60 days of Huber will be permanently Stayed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron M Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From Atty Weitzner and Atty Bricco dated 3/18/16 regarding proper addresses for defendants.

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron M Davis
Current: 320 E Main Street, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2016)
Prior: 2423 Willowood Dr,#c, Waukesha, WI 53188

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Aaron M Davis in court, in custody, with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guity plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER      *Consecutive to 15CM1853*

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    *Concurrent with 15CM1853*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: Kohls Department stores

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - for 60 Days Day Report Center.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If Defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 60 Days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed.

Defendant Aaron M Davis in court, in custody, with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests a quick plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Aaron M Davis in court, in custody, with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests a 45 day adjournment.  Court adjourns.     Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to have no contact with Discount Liquor.

Defendant Aaron M Davis in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant allowed a non collect call/calls.
  Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Aaron M Davis not in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
